member.name: T:RealWorld.Areas.Rest.Models.AppLink
member.summary: This is an example of a hypermedia "control" or affordance

member.name: P:RealWorld.Areas.Rest.Models.AppLink.Rel
member.summary: This is the link relation to the resource representation being return. It's usually a unique string that the client application can write code against instead of attempting to build URLs. If the link relation is unique to the application, it could take the form of: http://applicationDomain/schema/orderPayment so it can be easily looked by developers. Simple unique strings should not "collide" with the IANA registery of link relations.

member.name: P:RealWorld.Areas.Rest.Models.AppLink.Method
member.summary: The uniform interface method to invoke on this link. For HTTP, it could be GET, POST, DELETE, or some such valid HTTP method.

member.name: P:RealWorld.Areas.Rest.Models.AppLink.Href
member.summary: The resource URI to drive the next step in the interaction.

member.name: P:RealWorld.Areas.Rest.Models.AppLink.Description
member.summary: Optional short description of the link relationship

member.name: T:RealWorld.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator
member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:RealWorld.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.
